title: Mali-400 MP
text:
Mali-400 MP is a <a href="Mali%20%28GPU%29">Mali</a> series <a href="Graphics%20processing%20unit">GPU</a> produced by <a href="Arm%20Holdings">ARM Holdings</a>.
Is one of the world's most shipped mobile GPUs across multiple platforms. It was the first Mali GPU to offer multi-core implementation. The Mali-400 GPU scaled from 1–4 cores and was the world’s first OpenGL ES 2.0 conformant multi core GPU. Focusing on reduced power and bandwidth consumption, the Mali-400 GPU was selected for reduced cost devices.
There are several versions, the MP1 and the MP4, the most common and used, is the quad-core version, "Multi-core" also called "Mali-400 MP4" with frequencies ranging from 210 <a href="MegaHertz">Mhz</a> to 500 Mhz, develop respectively 12 <a href="GigaFLOPS">Gigaflops</a> and 18 Gigaflops of computing power. Semiconductors are manufactured by ARM Holdings, and ARM <a href="Application-specific%20integrated%20circuit">ASIC</a> partner licenses. The core is mainly developed by ARM, at the former Falanx company.
It is the world's first <a href="OpenGL%20ES%202.0">OpenGL ES 2.0</a>-compliant <a href="Multi-core%20processor">multi-core</a> GPU capable of delivering 2D and <a href="3D%20acceleration">3D acceleration</a> with performance up to <a href="1080p">1080p</a> resolution.
It is a pure <a href="3D%20engine">3D engine</a> that renders the graphics in memory and passes the rendered image onto another core which manages the display. ARM provides the tools necessary to create OpenGL ES <a href="Shader">shaders</a> exact names: Mali GPU Shader Development Studio and Mali GPU Engine User Interface. It is mounted on various <a href="System%20on%20a%20chip">System-on-a-chip</a> (SoC) including: the <a href="Samsung%20Galaxy%20S%20II">Samsung Galaxy S2</a>, <a href="Samsung%20Galaxy%20S%20III">Samsung Galaxy S3</a>.
